title: Measuring the Ocean
caption: The Ocean Observatories Initiative (OOI) has hundreds of instruments collecting data every minute of every day from locations (arrays) throughout the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans. Here we are looking at data from the Station Papa Array (highlighted in red) and the Coastal Endurance Array (green).

title: Global Station Papa Array
caption: The Station Papa Array is located in the north Pacific, off the coast of Alaksa. Data in this activity were collected from an instrument on Flanking Mooring A.

title: Coastal Endurance Array
caption: The Coastal Endurance Array is located of the Northwest coast of the US. Data in this activity were collected from an instrument on the Washington Inshore Surface Mooring.

title: CTD
caption: A CTD sesnsor collectes conductivity, temperature and depth, which can be used to calculate salinity and temperature as well.
